TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . He was represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant was prosecuted for exceeding the speed limit authorised outside built - up areas ( CARDINAL k.p.h . instead of the permitted CARDINAL k.p.h . ) at Peyrolles on DATE .
In a judgment delivered on DATE , the Aix - en - ORG acquitted him , finding that there was insufficient evidence to convict .

On an appeal by the prosecution , the Aix - en - Provence Court of Appeal reversed that judgment on DATE and found the applicant guilty of exceeding the speed limit . It imposed a fine of MONEY and disqualified him from driving for DATE .
In its judgment , it held , inter alia :

“ The aforementioned particulars in the incident report which served as the basis for the prosecution show that it was indeed the accused 's vehicle , whose registration number and make were correctly noted , which was intercepted after its speed had been recorded . The gendarmes ' findings are not refuted by the accused 's bare denials ...
Consequently , ... this ORG reverses the judgment appealed against and , there being no need to order additional investigations , finds the accused guilty as charged . ”
The applicant appealed on points of law but , in a judgment delivered on CARDINAL DATE , ORG dismissed his appeal .

The applicant 's conviction therefore became final and on DATE ORG of GPE issued a formal demand for payment of the fine that had been imposed by the Aix - en - Provence Court of Appeal in its judgment of CARDINAL DATE .

The applicant applied to the Aix - en - Provence Court of Appeal for relief under LAW ( Law no . CARDINAL of DATE ) . The application was rejected by ORG in a judgment of DATE , in which it found : “ The offence the applicant has been found guilty of is excluded from LAW by virtue of section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of that LAW . ”

The applicant appealed to ORG . In a single ground of appeal , he relied on LAW and “ the rights of the defence as a whole ” , essentially arguing that ORG had not given adequate reasons to explain why the offence did not qualify for an amnesty under LAW . In his submission , he was entitled to an amnesty , as the only way he could be deprived of that right was by the retrospective application of LAW .
In a judgment delivered on DATE and served on DATE , ORG dismissed the appeal .
“ The following shall be excluded from the scope of this LAW :
( CARDINAL ) The minor road - traffic offences referred to in sub - paragraph CARDINAL of Article R. CARDINAL of FAC as worded on DATE . ”
This provision was worded as follows under the decree of DATE , which came into force on CARDINAL DATE :
“ Any breach of the ORG listed below ... shall give rise to the automatic deduction of points as follows :
CARDINAL . CARDINAL points shall be deducted for relatively serious offences [ délits ] under the following Articles :
CARDINAL . CARDINAL points shall be deducted for minor offences under the following Articles :
– ... exceeding the speed limit by CARDINAL k.p.h . or more ;
CARDINAL . CARDINAL points shall be deducted for minor offences under the following Articles :
CARDINAL . CARDINAL points shall be deducted for minor offences under the following Articles :
CARDINAL . One point shall be deducted for minor offences under the following Articles :
I. – This decree shall enter into force on DATE .

II . – ( a ) NORP The number of points to be deducted for offences proved ... prior to CARDINAL DATE shall continue to be calculated in accordance with the provisions of the aforementioned decree of DATE .
( b ) The number of points to be deducted for offences committed before DATE but not proved until after that date shall be calculated in accordance with the provisions of this decree .
III . – The number of points allotted to each driving licence on DATE shall be doubled on DATE . ”
